citation.article-title: Actinocatenispora rupis sp. nov., isolated from cliff soil, and emended description of the genus Actinocatenispora
citation.source: International Journal of Systematic and Evolutionary Microbiology

p.s: Emended description of the genus Actinocatenispora Thawai et al. 2006
The description is as given by Thawai et al. (2006) with the following amendments.
Spore chains are borne on the aerial mycelium or produced directly from the vegetative mycelium.
Characteristic whole-cell sugars are arabinose and xylose.
The presence of galactose as a whole-cell sugar is variable, depending on the strain.
MK-9(H4) is a major menaquinone; the presence of MK-9(H6) and MK-9(H8) is strain-dependent.
The predominant fatty acids are iso- and anteiso-methyl branched acids.
The DNA G+C content is 72.0–74.3 mol%.
